3.text: CITB Health, Safety and Environment Test Requirements for a CSCS card

9.text: To apply for most CSCS cards, you need to show that you've passed the CITB Health Safety and Environment Test in the last two years.

18.text: The test is designed to make sure everyone has a minimum level of health, safety and environmental awareness before going on site.

26.text: The test has different levels which fit the various jobs and roles on site.

31.text: For example, labourers and bricklayers need to pass the Operative Level Test while Quantity Surveyors or Architects need the Managerial and Professional Level Test.

42.text: So how do you make sure you get the test you need?

48.text: To find exactly what card and what level test you need, go to cscs.uk.com/cardfinder and look up your job title or role.

61.text: You then need to book your test at citb.co.uk/test with a choice of times and locations which costs £19.50.  Remember to note what ID you need to take with you when you go.

76.text: Don't forget to prepare for the test. There's lots of support and revision guides available at citb.co.uk/revision
